title: Import fails to import mail folders
content: Please excuse me if I don't have all the terminologies right. After repeated failures to import my Mail folders to Supernova, I copied my entire profile from the previous version, the one just before 115.3.1 (64-bit), to another hard drive. Then I uninstalled Thunderbird and deleted the remaining files in AppData\Local and AppData\Roaming. Then I got a fresh copy of Supernova and copied the old files into AppData\Roaming. Next, I used the Import feature, selecting 'Import from another Thunderbird installation'. Under the 'Choose what to import', I initially selected all four options, but that didn't work at all. Next I selected just 'Accounts and Settings'. That worked. So, next I selected 'Mail Messages'. That seemed to be working for a couple of minutes before an Error Message appeared which read 'Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console'. So, I closed the program and then opened it again. Oddly enough, a few of the Local Folders showed up. The other 16 folder did not. I've supplied six screenshots so you can see what's still missing. What am I missing?

title: Cartella non sincronizzata POP - Hotmail - Outlook - outlook.live
content:
Cartella non sincronizzata POP - Hotmail - Outlook - outlook.live

Salve, Thunderbird non mi sincronizza / scarica una cartella presente invece sul server Hotmail, si tratta della cartella POP. Tale cartella è invece correttamente gestita con il programma “Mail” per MacOS, viene correttamente visualizzata anche tramite accesso alla casella mail tramite browser.

Per chiarezza aggiungo che la cartella POP viene creata automaticamente da outlook.live in alcuni casi specifici (vedi schermata allegata con impostazioni di outlook.live)

Allego anche schermata in cui si vede tale cartella in “Mail” per MacOS e schermata di Thunderbird con le impostazioni delle cartelle da scaricare.

Ho provato a cercare / modificare nelle varie impostazioni di Thunderbird ma niente da fare, non trovo la soluzione.

A disposizioni per ulteriori chiarimenti vi ringrazio e saluto. Toni
creator: tonimerlott

title: Keeping downloaded emails off provider's servers
content:
I want to download my emails periodically and save them in a folder on my computer (ideally in Thunderbird) - and not have them synced back to the email service providers' (ESP) servers (Microsoft, Yahoo, etc).

For example, I used to Export an email folder from Outlook Online (or whatever the f they are calling it now), download the resulting file, then delete the emails from Outlook Online. But that doesn't work anymore for some reason.

The idea is to periodically get my emails off the ESP servers, and save them on my computer - all done/saved in Thunderbird if possible. It would be a good feature to have. Or maybe it can already be done?

TIA

title: Problems with 115.3.1 on Mac (Monterey)
content:
Hello,

I upgraded to the 115 version of Thunderbird (with Mac, Monterey), the first time with 115.2, now with 115.3.1. The problem is always the same: I see my mailboxes, and it shows how many unread messages they contain. I am even able to send messages. But I am unable to read the messages themselves. It just shows ... nothing, even if I look at the local folders. Interestingly, I can read an old message which was displayed in a new tab. It looks as if I cannot open the mailboxes.

I have tried all kind of things: emptying the cache, restarting Thunderbird, installing a new version. In my earlier post, Wayne Mery suggested my posting the error console, here is what it says (now that I am on 115.3.1):

services.settings: Failed to load last_modified.json: TypeError: NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource. Utils.sys.mjs:322 Found 0 public keys and 0 secret keys (0 protected, 0 unprotected) RNPLib.jsm:551:15 WebGL context was lost. 2 Troubleshoot.sys.mjs:710:17 Trying to load /Applications/Thunderbird.app/Contents/MacOS/libotr.dylib OTRLib.sys.mjs:65:11 Successfully loaded OTR library /Applications/Thunderbird.app/Contents/MacOS/libotr.dylib OTRLib.sys.mjs:73:13 tb.account.size_on_disk - Attempted to set the scalar to an incompatible value. 2

​---------- I went into troubleshooting mode, looked at the Information, but nothing seemed to be relevant.

Any help will be welcome .... Thank you in advance, Zoé C.

title: Thunderbird as a snap can't open attachments
content:
Ubuntu has not yet released Thunderbird Supernova, so I downloaded the snap of version 115.3.0, which works fine, except...

I must now save an attachment and open it outside T'bird. Attempting to open an attachment in T'bird does nothing, and throws the following apparmor error in syslog:

Oct 1 08:44:12 sibelman-desktop kernel: [108576.091868] audit: type=1400 audit(1696175052.088:36110): apparmor="DENIED" operation="exec" class="file" profile="snap.thunderbird.thunderbird" name="/run/user/1000/doc/961b38a1/okular" pid=111916 comm="thunderbird-bin" requested_mask="x" denied_mask="x" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

Running the "normal" binary (version 115.3.1), downloaded but not "installed", works fine.

The snap permissions don't appear to offer a way to fix this (see attached image). How can it be fixed?

Note: I don't really need to run Thunderbird as a snap but I'd like to, especially as I prefer some kind of management of the apps on my system, rather than relying on the manual method. btw, it appears I cannot revert to my pre-Supernova version, as Supernova seems to have modified my profile to make that difficult or impossible.

Is there any way to get back to the old format?
